Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: disruption n 1: an act of delaying or interrupting the continuity; "it was presented without commercial breaks" [syn: {break}, {interruption}, {gap}] 2: a disorderly outburst or tumult; "they were amazed by the furious disturbance they had caused" [syn: {disturbance}, {commotion}, {stir}, {flutter}, {hurly burly}, {to-do}, {hoo-ha}, {hoo-hah}, {kerfuffle}] 3: an event that results in a displacement or discontinuity [syn: {dislocation}] 4: the act of causing disorder [syn: {perturbation}]
